body:
https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/64741a1f1e5259a372bca51b70f4e41b3d2fd34c/src/server/raft_client.rs#L27

The send size is limited to 10MiB. It's a reasonable value in the past as we limit the size of a single entry to 8MiB and the a raft message to 1MiB. Hence a raft message can't be larger than 8MiB. But since using batch gRPC, several messages are merged into one, the total size in a round of call can reach 10 * 8 = 80MiB and exceed the limit. You can find gRPC connection is reset very frequently when there are a lot of batch write requests.


title: The default size limit of grpc is too small after using batch grpc
